text:
A section of nurses of the Govt. Vellore Medical College Hospital, Adukkamparai, participated

Nurses draw the attention of the State government towards their three-point charter of demands in Vellore on Friday.—Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

Members of the Tamil Nadu Government Nurses Association, Vellore staged a demonstration on Friday to draw the attention of the State government towards their three-point charter of demands.

A section of nurses belonging to the Government Vellore Medical College Hospital, Adukkamparai, participated in the protest on the hospital premises. M. Samuel, vice president of the association’s Vellore branch, said they were demanding scrapping of consolidate pay, and bringing those employed on contract basis on time scale pay. “We are also demanding grant of time-bound promotion,” he said.

He added that if the time-bound promotions are implemented, then those on consolidate pay can be regularised in the existing vacancies.

The nurses are also demanding scrapping of Contributory Pension Scheme (CPS), and bringing back the old pension scheme. The demonstration was held after the association’s State-level talks with Health Minister and Health Secretary ended in a stalemate.

Protest by govt. employees

Meanwhile, a number of government employees spent the night on the pavement in front of the Collector’s office as part of their relay protest.

The struggle committee members said they were waiting for the decision of the State-level meeting of the committee to decide the further course of action.

The government employees have been striking from work for the last 10 days urging the government to look into their demands.
title: Nurses protest demanding time-bound promotions
